question: Which country houses the underwater cave "Cosquer Cave"?
explanation: Cosquer Cave is an underwater cave/grotto, located in the Calanque de Morgiou of France. The entrance to the cave is located underwater due to the Holocene sea-level rise. The cave is famous for the numerous cave drawings dating back as far as 27000 years BP. Four-fifths of the cave, including any cave wall art, were permanently or periodically submerged and destroyed by seawater.
